before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"an68m","text":"Obtain a soil sample containing at least 20 pea-sized aggregates and air dry it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

creator.name: Claire L Phillips
creator.affiliation: USDA-ARS Northwest Sustainable Agroecosystems Research Unit

affiliations.affiliation: USDA-ARS Northwest Sustainable Agroecosystems Research Unit

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ao2vt","text":"This describes a process to measure soil wet aggregate stability through slaking, or rapid immersion it water. It uses a multi-well plate to process many aggregates at one time. Air dry, pea-sized aggregates (3-10 mm) are submerged in water and time lapse images are collected with a web cam to measure their dispersion (slaking) over 10 minutes. Image-J software is used to measure the projected area of the aggregates over time. Python code is also provided to automate image analysis. Slaking index is calculated from the change in projected area of the aggregates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"8su2h","text":"This method is suitable for soils with moderate to high wet aggregate stability. It is not suitable for highly unstable aggregates that are likely to completely disintegrate when submerged.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"c1tfd","text":"Phillips, C.L., Casanova, J.J., Emmett, B.D. A high throughput approach for measuring soil slaking index. Submitted to Soil Science Society of America Journal (July 2023).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text:
{"blocks":[{"key":"ba6et","text":" Multi-well tray (see notes below and GitHub - cafltar/PySlake).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":38,"length":24}],"data":{}},{"key":"aa2bs","text":" A computer with these programs:
        Microsoft’s “Camera” application, or equivalent.
        ImageJ (https://imagej.nih.gov/ij/download.html)
        R (https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bnf2","text":"A light colored or clear soaking dish that can accommodate the multi-well tray.
If using a clear dish, place a sheet of white paper underneath it.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23v5","text":"A webcam and data cable","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87rlq","text":"A tripod or bench-mounted support to hold the webcam","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7sbq8","text":"Two bench top lights to illuminate the peds.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mloj","text":"A means of diffusing or bouncing the lights to prevent reflections on the water surface. The lights can be aimed at large pieces of white paper placed behind and above the tray to indirectly illuminate the tray.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3u4i6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fee47","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1qjj8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75mhv","text":"Options for making a multi-well tray","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74cb3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcv02","text":"We provide a 3D print file for a multi-well tray with dimensions that we found to be optimal: GitHub - cafltar/PySlake","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":94,"length":24}],"data":{}},{"key":"bbh53","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vsal","text":"However, many possible materials can be used for the multi-will tray if the user does not have access to a 3D printer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fshf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3m6lc","text":"The original SLAKES application required a light-colored or transparent dish, to create high contrast between the dark peds and a light background. We used light-colored materials for early versions of the multi-well tray (Fig M2-A and B). The image processing protocol presented here works especially well for processing such images, because making the image binary allows the light background materials disappear. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"474pi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hkh6","text":"For later versions we constructed a green tray (Fig M2-C), and the distinctive color allowed us to automate identifying the location of each well. Python code found here (GitHub - cafltar/PySlake) can be used as an alternative to the Image-J process in this method.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":196,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":171,"length":24}],"data":{}},{"key":"2k152","text":"

 Our preferred tray design (Fig M2-C) has overall dimensions of 17 × 26 cm, which fits in many commercially available flat-bottomed tubs. It has 20 wells with individual diameters of 4.5 cm and a 1 cm wall height. The overall size allowed the camera projection to be almost straight-down across the whole tray, without distortion or obstruction at the edges. The tray design also incorporated stand-offs to receive 12 mm diameter nuts and bolts, which provided extra mass to help submerge the tray quickly. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":2,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"u7ba","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bolu1","text":"Nylon mesh fabric (~1 mm opening), commercially sold in fabric stores as bridal veil, was secured with cyanoacrylate glue to the bottom of the tray as a platform for the peds.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dfh6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"953AB331257D11EE995B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/cafltar/PySlake"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"56DF0B4021D611EEBECA4DDAB4538892","height":374,"id":390580,"is_video":false,"legend":"{"blocks":[{"key":"6qj8i","text":"Figure M1. A set-up for collecting slaking images.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"BenchSetup_WhiteBackground.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7pybyyi7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7pwbyyi7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7pxbyyi7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7pvbyyi7.webp","width":550}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5960B40A257D11EE995B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/cafltar/PySlake"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7C8D8C61257D11EE995B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/cafltar/PySlake"}},"4":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"62D13D4021D311EEBECA4DDAB4538892","height":309,"id":390576,"is_video":false,"legend":"{"blocks":[{"key":"4k8nv","text":"Figure M2. Examples of different kinds of multi-well trays evaluated for slaking. (A) A 6-well culture plate with 3.5 cm diameter wells (Corning part number 3516). (B) A polyethylene 36-compartment box with 2.5 × 3 cm compartments. The\nbottom was cut away with a hot knife, and nylon mesh glued on to provide support for soil peds. (C) A 20-well tray made with a three-dimensional printer, 4.75 cm diameter wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"FigS1_DifferentKindsOfTrays.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7pubyyi7.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7psbyyi7.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7ptbyyi7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7prbyyi7.webp","width":550}}}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4so5j","text":"Flynn, K.D., D.K. Bagnall, and C.L.S. Morgan. 2020. Evaluation of SLAKES, a smartphone application for quantifying aggregate stability, in high‐clay soils. Soil Sci Soc Am J 84(2): 345–353. doi: 10.1002/saj2.20012.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mm9v","text":"Phillips, C.L., Casanova, J.J., Emmett, B.D. A high throughput approach for measuring soil slaking index. Submitted to Soil Science Society of America Journal (July 2023).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6f2o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"529g9","text":"Rieke, E.L., D.K. Bagnall, C.L.S. Morgan, K.D. Flynn, J.A. Howe, et al. 2022. Evaluation of aggregate stability methods for soil health. Geoderma 428: 116156. doi: 10.1016/j.geoderma.2022.116156.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fig5j","text":"


","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2ttrn","text":"Establish how you will count the wells (across or down) and create a spreadsheet identifying the sample in each well. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57fqj","text":"Example Document:   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":18,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"63cck","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"67692CB0120011EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":0,"id":383953,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"text/csv","original_name":"SiteName P16_P17_P20_Time4_Samples.csv","placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/extensions/csv.png","raw_source":"","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/my8tb6zvp.csv","type":5,"width":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3buv8","text":"The well plate we provided a 3D print file for has a notch in the upper left corner to identify the first column and row.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":121,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cfdi2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"22AF11B0120111EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":337,"id":390586,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"3h1k0\",\"text\":\"\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"WIN_20230623_10_27_07_Pro.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7p6b6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7p4b6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7p5b6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7p3b6zvp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ejakc","text":"Make sure the tray is clean and dry, and the mesh is secured to the bottom (no tears or gaps).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cu79j","text":"Place an air-dried pea-sized aggregate (3-10 mm in diameter) in the center of each well.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":89,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"doht8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"992E46A0120411EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":460,"id":390590,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"utii\",\"text\":\"\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"1dryagg.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qab6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7p8b6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7p9b6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7p7b6zvp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"317jg","text":"In Microsoft Windows, type camera into search bar to find Camera app","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cglt4","text":"In the Camera app, select the correct webcam by toggling the rotate camera icon in the upper right corner.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":106,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ak04l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D3DD06900A3B11EE88FE81AAC1CB3637","height":121,"id":390594,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"cipsf\",\"text\":\"\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qebyyi7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qcbyyi7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qdbyyi7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qbbyyi7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"t7ig","text":"Take a reference image of the dry aggregates. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6t6s","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"atk28","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AA53A6B0144211EE9BF7D1FC804A9CF0","height":295,"id":390598,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"3qb58\",\"text\":\"\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"15camera with tray.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qib6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qgb6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qhb6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qfb6zvp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bqjlv","text":"Adjust the brightness as needed to ensure strong contrast between the aggregates and the background.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eii9c","text":"Draw a light line in permanent marker around the well plate so you can return it to the same location consistently.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":115,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bpj0j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D08B2360120511EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":444,"id":390602,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"9rr57\",\"text\":\"\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"2outline.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qnb6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qkb6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qmb6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qjb6zvp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"755ud","text":"Carefully remove the multi-well tray from the soaking dish. Fill the dish with at least 2 cm water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dkdga","text":"In the Camera App toggle the time lapse to 5 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2d438","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5a74e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E48064400B9B11EEB2F2C3A420C33242","height":211,"id":390606,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qsb6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qqb6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qrb6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qpb6zvp.webp","width":118}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ucgh","text":"Time lapse may need to be turned on in the settings of the Camera App.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9btf1","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2qde1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"67ECECB00B9F11EEB2F2C3A420C33242","height":472,"id":390610,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qwb6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qub6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qvb6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qtb6zvp.webp","width":262}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e20qi","text":"Set up a timer for ten minutes and begin the time lapse. Transfer the multi-well tray with the dry aggregates to the pan filled with water. Quickly and carefully submerge the aggregates. Place them in the same location as the in the reference photo.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":249,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7p238","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"453723F0144311EE9BF7D1FC804A9CF0","height":309,"id":390614,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"16 handhands.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7q2b6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qyb6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qzb6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7qxb6zvp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fckdo","text":"Let the time lapse run at a 5 second interval for the first minute of recording, then toggle the time lapse to the 10 second interval without pausing or stopping the time lapse.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edjn1","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lri3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a29m3","text":"Within the file directory where project data will be saved create a folder representing the sample that was tested. E.g. C:\\Users\\REM\\Documents\\SLAKES\\SampleNameTime1_Depth1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8uok2","text":"Within the Samples folder create a folder for the images collected from the sample. E.g. C:\\Users\\REM\\Documents\\SLAKES\\SampleNameTime1_Depth1\\Images","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4gtjr","text":"Move the captured images to the Images folder created in step 12.1   . The default save location for the Camera app is the Camera Roll subfolder in the active user's Pictures folder. E.g. C:\\Users\\REM\\Pictures\\Camera Roll","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e2b6t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F9B40660120711EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","id":0,"step_guid":"BA656A000BA211EEB2F2C3A420C33242","title":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"66op","text":"Ensure the Camera Roll folder    is empty before starting a different sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":30,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9a5hn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51828290120811EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","id":0,"step_guid":"89D868A00BA311EEB2F2C3A420C33242","title":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3sjvf","text":"With ImageJ open, import the collected images. This can be done by dragging and dropping the images from the image folder created in step 12.1.   The images can also be imported through ImageJ by selecting 'File' from the menu followed by 'import' and then 'Image sequence'.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":144,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":274,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"gksu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3921A2100BAC11EEB37EE93FD95EF392","id":0,"step_guid":"BA656A000BA211EEB2F2C3A420C33242","title":""}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D50786F0120911EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":504,"id":390618,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"3Imageseq.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7q6b6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7q4b6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7q5b6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7q3b6zvp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8rc79","text":"If importing through the Drag and Drop method the images will need to be converted to a stack. From the menu select 'Image', 'Stacks', and 'Images to Stack'.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":158,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bpf6g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8265D9F0120A11EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":427,"id":390622,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"4Img2stk.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rab6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7q8b6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7q9b6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7q7b6zvp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ftn","text":"Navigate the image stack with the left and right arrow keys. Make sure the images are in order. Delete any images with hands or other interference in them. Through the menu select 'Image', 'Stacks' and 'Delete Slice'.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":218,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"284p5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8F8A9BB0120B11EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":263,"id":390626,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"5delslice.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7reb6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rcb6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rdb6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rbb6zvp.webp","width":550}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aqsfj","text":"Set the Scale of the Image with the Straight Line Tool in ImageJ.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"71f98","text":"Drag the Straight Line Tool across a well plate.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":48,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2lj3k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1EF48440120D11EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":516,"id":390630,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"6linetool.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rib6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rgb6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rhb6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rfb6zvp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"kpar","text":"In the ImageJ menu go to 'Analyze' and 'Set Scale'. Enter the measured length of the single well in the Known distance section, Change the Unit of length to mm.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1no06","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7F0B5CF0120D11EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":413,"id":390634,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rnb6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rkb6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rmb6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rjb6zvp.webp","width":361}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7nsiv","text":"Change the image stack to the 8-bit format by selecting 'Image', 'Type', and '8-bit'.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":86,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6sua4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"EFE97280120E11EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":118,"id":390638,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"8bit how convenient.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rsb6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rqb6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rrb6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rpb6zvp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eva5l","text":"Crop the image stack down to the area with just the well plate in it by selecting using the square selection tool and from the menu selecting 'Image' and 'Crop'.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":162,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8aa9p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"57832A40120E11EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":576,"id":390642,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"7Cropandsoils.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rwb6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rub6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rvb6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rtb6zvp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c7um6","text":"In the Menu select 'Analyze', 'Tools' and 'ROI Manager' to open the Region of Interest (ROI) Manager tool.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":106,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6juc8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0CA8A660121011EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":372,"id":390646,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"9ROI.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7r2b6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7ryb6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rzb6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7rxb6zvp.webp","width":550}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9eri7","text":"Use the oval or rectangle tool to select the first well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8c4tv","text":"In the ROI Manager click Add or use the T as a shortcut to add the selection to the ROI manager tool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6pvsm","text":"Check the Show All checkbox to confirm numbers and locations as you add each individual well.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":93,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9va3p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"77CBDD90121011EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":398,"id":390650,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"10ROIdos.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7r6b6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7r4b6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7r5b6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7r3b6zvp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8crjs","text":" In the Menu select 'Process', 'Binary', and 'Make Binary'.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":59,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8v2u8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"282A6650121311EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":248,"id":390654,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"11binary.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7sab6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7r8b6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7r9b6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7r7b6zvp.webp","width":550}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"83tdm","text":"Uncheck the \"Black background\" box.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a0irh","text":"Make the image stack a set of Binary images.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"jd5o","text":"Images in the stack should generate a red layer over the soil aggregates. If any shadows are picked up during this stage they will also appear in red. If this happens cancel the Make Binary action and adjust the Contrast through the Menu by selecting Image then Adjust and Brightness/Contrast until shadows no longer appear in the selected ROIs.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":345,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bk8hu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"DEDE6720121311EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":360,"id":390658,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"12binarydos.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7seb6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7scb6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7sdb6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7sbb6zvp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8lnv5","text":"In the Menu select 'Analyze' then 'Set Measurements'. This will open the Set Measurements menu, which dictates what the ROI manager will analyze.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":146,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"af7qo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"96FA3550121411EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":218,"id":390662,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"13setmeas.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7sib6zvp.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7sgb6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7shb6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7sfb6zvp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1e5r7","text":"In the Set Measurements menu select Area, Stack position, and Limit to Threshold. The Redirect to dropdown should be set to None and the Decimal places box should be set to 3.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":175,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d3dic","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"35BE1680121411EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":499,"id":390666,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7snb6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7skb6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7smb6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7sjb6zvp.webp","width":321}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"41v3h","text":"From the ROI manager window select 'More' and 'Multi Measure' to open the Multi Measure menu.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":94,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5trjf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"79C48700121511EEB482BF6EC0AAD91E","height":416,"id":390670,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"14MultiMeas.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7ssb6zvp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7sqb6zvp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7srb6zvp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m7spb6zvp.webp","width":397}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fefer","text":"In the Multi Measure menu check the boxes for 'Measure all # Slices' and One row per slice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2l6pa","text":"Save the Multi Measure results in the sample folder created in step 12  . The filename should match the format being used with '_Results' appended at the end.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":71,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2sl5f","text":"E.g. SampleNameTime1_Depth1_Results.csv","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1EF3A54011DE11EE899CDDF38F3CE8A3","id":0,"step_guid":"D0B396400B9F11EEB2F2C3A420C33242","title":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"duh5q","text":"Start with air-dried soil that was not previously sieved. It is recommended to measure at least 9 to 12 pea-sized (3 to 10 mm) aggregates per soil sample. More replication is useful for unstable soils. See Phillips et al. (submitted 2023) for more information on necessary replication. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dd1sf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1q5ku","text":"If the soil sample is consolidated and does not have enough pea-sized aggregates, it can be sieved through a 8 mm mesh sieve to break it up.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9942m","text":"This R script provides example code for using the Image-J output to plot area timeseries and compute slaking index following Flynn et al. (2020).   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":146,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eebac","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"DC6EF890228C11EEBECA4DDAB4538892","id":389598,"original_name":"ComputeSlakingIndex.R","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m6q8byyi7.r"}}}}
